pullRequest.body:
as a syntax linter, extending `adomani`'s `cdot` syntax linter.

---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [02d9dc1263](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15017/commits/02d9dc12635b8a0a0c72f6b81a9bf685af76c95b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`- instance (f g : Nat â†’ Nat) : Inhabited Nat`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Thanks for this!

How about extending the `cdot` linter, though?  Here is a sample of how to do that:
```lean
import Mathlib.Tactic.Linter

open Lean in
/-- `line_breaks?` flags "isolated `Â·` in the following command -/
elab "line_breaks? " cmd:command : command => do
  Elab.Command.elabCommand cmd
  for cdot in Mathlib.Linter.findCDot cmd do
    match cdot.find? (Â·.isOfKind `token.Â«Â· Â») with
      | some (.node _ _ #[.atom (.original _ _ afterCDot _) _]) =>
        if (afterCDot.takeWhile (Â·.isWhitespace)).contains '\n' then
          logWarningAt cdot m!"Found an isolated `Â·`!"
      | _ => return

line_breaks?
example : True âˆ§ True := by
  constructor
--v this `Â·` is flagged
  Â·
    exact .intro
--v this `Â·` is flagged
  Â·
    --
    exact .intro
  Â· -- if I write a long comment here
    -- there is no warning
    exact .intro
```
@adomani Good idea, that is even nicer. I just adapted the linter accordingly; it should be ready for review again.

Thanks!

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10664661415/job/29556381293)
I just merged master again; the recent fix-ups look good to me.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10671321982/job/29576899297)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10671321982/job/29576899681)

Thanks!

As I was involved in writing part of the code, I'll just approve of these changes, but it looks good!
I think this is ready to be merged, but I think it make sense to add a dependency on #15845, merge that first, and then make sure this linter is imported in `Mathlib.Init`

Thanks!

As I was involved in writing part of the code, I'll just approve of these changes, but it looks good!
bors merge

```suggestion
It also flags "isolated cdots", i.e. when the `Â·` is on its own line.
```
I believe you used `â¬` (`\cdot`) instead of  `Â·` (`\.` or `\centerdot`). Maybe the `"cdot"` above is confusing and should be adjusted...

```suggestion
It also flags "isolated cdots", i.e. when the `Â·` is on its own line. -/
```
This fixes a merge error: the same test is already present on line 158.
Indeed, although its [line 127 on the resulting file](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/3c4d23a560483d82fe8ad39580429fcfb3bc5936/test/Lint.lean#L127-L143).

```suggestion
```
Is this just a git merge gone wrong and it is simply a repetition of the tests above it?
That was a merge error - thanks for spotting!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(lint-style): rewrite focusing dot check in Lean

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Thanks for this!

How about extending the `cdot` linter, though?  Here is a sample of how to do that:
```lean
import Mathlib.Tactic.Linter

open Lean in
/-- `line_breaks?` flags "isolated `Â·` in the following command -/
elab "line_breaks? " cmd:command : command => do
  Elab.Command.elabCommand cmd
  for cdot in Mathlib.Linter.findCDot cmd do
    match cdot.find? (Â·.isOfKind `token.Â«Â· Â») with
      | some (.node _ _ #[.atom (.original _ _ afterCDot _) _]) =>
        if (afterCDot.takeWhile (Â·.isWhitespace)).contains '\n' then
          logWarningAt cdot m!"Found an isolated `Â·`!"
      | _ => return

line_breaks?
example : True âˆ§ True := by
  constructor
--v this `Â·` is flagged
  Â·
    exact .intro
--v this `Â·` is flagged
  Â·
    --
    exact .intro
  Â· -- if I write a long comment here
    -- there is no warning
    exact .intro
```
@adomani Good idea, that is even nicer. I just adapted the linter accordingly; it should be ready for review again.
I think this is ready to be merged, but I think it make sense to add a dependency on #15845, merge that first, and then make sure this linter is imported in `Mathlib.Init`

source.title: chore: move style linters to the `style` namespace
chore: move style linters into their own file; document all current linters
